sentence.Network_en: Training camp, he said, will quickly ingrain those principles.

sentence.Network_en: Ingrain into your website, your unique affiliate links, wherever you see fit.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (originally as engrain in the sense 'dye with cochineal or in fast colours'): from en-, in- (as an intensifier) + the verb grain. The adjective is from in grain 'fast-dyed', from the old use of grain meaning 'kermes, cochineal'

means.word_mean: 2. produce or try to produce a vivid impression of;
